divs: sighting detailsdriving west on highway 8, just east of welton, arizona. i was in the front passenger seat with a clear view of the very tail end of dusk with a cloudy sky. had just finished watching a plane headed east fly over. probably took about 2-3 minutes from first seeing it till it passed out of sight. the plane was high above and to the right of the passenger side window, which was open. the plane was below the clouds. i could clearly see the flashing red and green wing lights and the white 'headlights'. was enjoying viewing the rest of the sky, when a sudden bright white\yellowish light caught my eye. to me, it was around the same height as the plane i had just viewed. certainly not tower lights located on the ground. there was a tower with red lights and a tower just to the right of that with white lights straight ahead of us on the horizon. this first 'ufo' light (and 5 more), i viewed out the front windshield, above and to the left of the tower lights on the ground. anyway...the light in the sky was larger than any of the stars...maybe the size of this 'o'. just imagine it in the sky. it quickly faded out. i wasn't sure at first what it was. wondering if it was another plane that disappeared in clouds, but then thinking it was brighter than the plane i had just viewed, and that it was already in front of the clouds. just as i was thinking that, another similar light quickly appeared in a different spot, but same area of the sky. i said, "huh?" i quickly looked at the surrounding stars and the tower lights for comparison. then this light also faded out. as soon as it was out, another light appeared in different spot, same area, and faded as well. i made a gesture towards the area and was like, "whaaaaat the f**k?" to my boyfriend. as both of us this time were looking, two lights suddenly appeared then faded away. the timing of the fading was slightly off. they didn't fade at the exact same time. ....funny....when he first noticed me staring out the windshield, he asked if i was looking at ufos.... the spacing of the two that appeared together was like this> o o no other lights then appeared at this moment. i was intently scanning the sky to see if there were anymore. then i noticed small red\yellow lights outside the driver's side window. my boyfriend tried to glimpse them, but was busy keeping the car on the road. these lights were approximately the size of this period> . not sure if it was two or more, but it almost looked like they were playing leap frog, occasionally going backwards. they weren't continuous lights shining, but were appearing\disappearing\appearing. i don't want to say flashing because they weren't. then they totally disappeared. i once again scanned the sky, even unbuckling my seatbelt so i could move and see more. i was crushed up against the front dash peering at the sky above the car when again i saw two lights appear and fade together. no more strange lights appeared (that i could see) after that. a couple seconds passed then i saw plane lights coming from the west, heading east outside my passenger window. it had to have been a jet because it was moving very fast. once it was behind us in the sky, it made a turn and headed quickly back west. as i was watching this plane, i also noticed another plane farther away and closer to the horizon, out my passenger side window. i could still make out its flashing lights. there were some other flashing lights that were really far away in other areas of the sky. i am going to assume these were planes as well. especially since yuma does have a somewhat large airport and we were headed in that direction. in all of my almost 34 years on earth, i have never seen lights like these in the sky. i have seen some strange things, but not even close to what i witnessed tonight. although the clouds with lightning but no thunder was pretty weird.... and that is the end of what i saw of the 'ufos'.
Summary: white lights in sky suddenly appearing, then dimming out, small colored lights playing leapfrog
trends: There have been no other sightings in just east of welton
This sighting has never been favorited.
